title: Mau Mau. Black man's land: images of colonialism and independance in Kenya
brief_description: Images of colonialism and independence in Kenya. A statement on British colonial policy in Kenya, the colony in British East Africa with the largest white population. Deals with the period from 1952 - 1957, when the “Mau Mau” were operating. Narrated by an African whose tone is bitter, the film looks at the Mau Mau from a different point of view.
